explanation: The bug was in the calculation line: it used min(d) (the smallest element of the list) where the largest value was intended. Using min(d) produces an unnecessarily small adjustment and can undercount the intended result. I replaced min(d) with max(d) so the expression uses the largest element of d as intended.
fixed_code:
n, p, q = map(int, input().split(' '))
d = list(map(int, input().split(' ')))
print(min(p, p - q + max(d)))
